Description: Gold diadem-ornament: the ornament has eight rays or petals, each made separately and consisting of a base-plate with an escape hole for air and curved upper part. The petals are soldered to a central base around a central circular boss. Between every two rays are two granules of gold alternating with a single granule. A ring for suspension is soldered in the centre at the back.
Curator's comments: This ornament is strikingly similar to a seven-pointed gold star worn on the forehead of the bearded man shown in portrait 1994,0521.12. Bibliography: H. Tait (ed.), 'Seven Thousand Years of Jewellery' (1986), fig. 207; K. Parlasca & H. Seeman, ‘Augenblicke, Mumienporträts un ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit’ (1999), 138 no. 40; S. Walker, Ancient Faces, New York 2000, p. 153 [109].
Bibliographic references: Walker, S 2000 / Ancient Faces: Mummy Portraits from Roman Egypt (109)
Parlasca & Seeman 1999 / Augenblicke. Mumienporträts und ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit (p.138, no.40)
Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (p.70)
